intro: Sunipia kipgenii, commonly known as the Kipgenii sunipia, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky crevices or among dense shrubs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of plant adaptation in extreme environments.
